Detailed Description

Simple interface to play any supported song format.

SongPlayer will examine the file to see if it is an SMF or XMF file. It will then choose the appropriate parser and do the necessary setup to play the file.

Please see the "examples/play_song.c" for an example of how to use the API. There is also a SongPlayer section in the Programming Guide.

Author:
Phil Burk, Robert Marsanyi Copyright 2004 Mobileer, PROPRIETARY and CONFIDENTIAL

Function Documentation

SPMIDI_Error SongPlayer_Create ( SongPlayer **  playerPtr,
SPMIDI_Context *  spmidiContext,
unsigned char *  songImage,
spmSInt32  numBytes 
)

Create a player for supported song type.

Set song to beginning. If song is an XMF song then it will load the associated DLS instruments. Note that this may only be called once for an spmidiContext. You must delete the context and create a new context if you want to play another song.

Parameters:
songImage address of song file image in memory
numBytes size of song file image
Returns:
0 if no error, or one of the following:
Exceptions:
SPMIDI_Error_IllegalArgument one or more pointers are NULL, or numBytes is not positive
SPMIDI_Error_OutOfMemory can't allocate memory for songplayer or its components
XMFParser_Error_ParseError miscellaneous parsing error
  • FileNode does not contain ResourceFormatID, or
  • Unpacker for FileNode is unrecognized
XMFParser_Error_WrongType file is not XMF Type 2 (Mobile XMF)
XMFParser_Error_SizeError file length, Tree Start or Tree End in header exceed actual size
DLSParser_Error_NotDLS Form chunk is not DLS
DLSParser_Error_ParseError miscellaneous parsing error:
  • no DLS instruments found
  • no pool table found
  • no wave data found
  • number of instruments found doesn't match list
  • number of regions found doesn't match list
  • region doesn't include WLNK or RGNH chunks
  • articulation chunk not contained in region or instrument
  • conditional chunk expression doesn't evaluate to true or false
  • wave data not inside WAVE chunk
  • wave data found before FMT chunk
  • number of loops in WSMP chunk is greater than 1
  • WSMP chunk is not associated with region or wave
SPMIDI_Error_BadFormat couldn't resolve pool table to loaded wave data
DLSParser_Error_UnsupportedSampleFormat wave data is not in a usable format
XMFParser_Error_DetachedNodeContentFound Mobile XMF does not allow content outside the file
SPMIDI_Error_DLSAlreadyLoaded this midi context already has a DLS Orchestra
MIDIFile_Error_NotSMF can't find midifile in image
MIDIFile_Error_IllegalFormat midi header or track is not valid
MIDIFile_Error_MissingEndOfTrack file ends before end of track
See also:
XMFParser_Create, XMFParser_Parse, XMFParser_GetDLS, DLSParser_Create, DLSParser_Parse, DLSParser_Load

void SongPlayer_Delete ( SongPlayer *  player  ) 

Delete the player data.

This does not delete the in-memory image. If song is an XMF song then it will unload the associated DLS instruments.

MIDIFilePlayer* SongPlayer_GetMIDIFilePlayer ( SongPlayer *  player  ) 

Get MIDIFile player if song is an SMF or XMF.

int SongPlayer_PlayFrames ( SongPlayer *  player,
int  numFrames 
)

Advance the player forward in the song by a time corresponding to the given number of audio frames.

After this, call SPMIDI_ReadFrames() to harvest the synthesized audio.

Returns:
0 if more events are available to play. 1 if finished.

SPMIDI_Error SongPlayer_Rewind ( SongPlayer *  player  ) 

Rewind song to beginning.

Returns:
0 if no error, or one of the following:
Exceptions:
MIDIFile_Error_NotSMF can't find midifile in image
MIDIFile_Error_IllegalFormat midi header or track is not valid
MIDIFile_Error_MissingEndOfTrack file ends before end of track

SPMIDI_Error SongPlayer_Start ( SongPlayer *  player  ) 

Start playing song.

Returns:
SPMIDI_Error_None

SPMIDI_Error SongPlayer_Stop ( SongPlayer *  player  ) 

Stop playing song.

Returns:
SPMIDI_Error_None
